data.title: Great Cafe!
data.text: Had breakfast at Janie's Cafe!  Had a great meal!  Food was great!  Staff were friendly!  Great service!

data.title: Excellent choice !
data.text:
Great food. Great atmosphere. But go early to try to get a seat on a Sunday morning! Went as a couple, sat at the counter - food comes hot - lots of it and the coffee is great!

The service is super fast! And it's very very busy. So be prepared to wait if you don't get there early enough on Sunday morning! I definitely would.

data.title: Pretty standard, nothing special
data.text: Stopped in for a late breakfast today.  Restaurant was full, a good sign.  Decaf coffee didn't taste fresh, omelet was tasty, husband said French toast was ok, not great.  I think I would stick to breakfast items if we ever eat here again.

data.title: The local hot spot
data.text: This is where the locals eat.  The place is full, but not packed.  Service is very good.  The breakfast burrito smothered in green chili (which looks red) is huge and excellent.

data.title: A Downtown Longmont Institution
data.text: Easy to overlook Janie's storefront but then you would be missing a great opportunity for a wonderful home cooked-style meal for a budget price. Janie's has it all in comfort, diner type foods with friendly service at a reasonable price! Public parking behind the restaurant is a definite bonus!

data.title: Home town Family Restaurant
data.text: This breakfast & lunch restaurant has been in Longmont a long time, their experience & food quality show it!  It is Always a pleasure to have these folks wait on me & my son.  They are personable, efficient, a well run establishment.  Everything on the menu is delicious, I usually have eggs, toast, sometimes pancakes, side salad, fruit, a cup of tea & water.  This restaurant aims to Please!

data.title: Good size portions
data.text: We stopped here for breakfast and for a diner experience while visiting the area.  I had the chicken fried steak and my wife bacon cheddar omelet.  The food was tasty and the portion was more than you could eat.  Service was prompt and friendly definitely a place to stop for breakfast.

data.title: Stand Up Hometown Cafe Downtown
data.text: We had a nice lunch at this diner.  The waitress was very attentive and the food good. The menu had a number of selections to choose from.  Hometown ambience: nothing fancy, just comfortable.

data.title: Just what we were looking for...
data.text:
My husband and I craved a greasy egg/hash brown/toast breakfast...This fit the bill 100%
Eggs over easy...done perfectly....hash browns crispy without being requested...my hubs slab of ham was hilariously huge...service was quick and friendly....kinda wished we lived there so we could visit often

data.title: Eat Here!!
data.text: I work in Longmont a few times a month and always want Janie's! It looks a little rundown from the outside, but the food is mouth-watering. I love the breakfast burrito. Highly recommend!

data.title: Great home cookin' comfort food
data.text: Been eating lunch here for years. Food is great, staff is friendly and welcoming. Place makes you feel like you're at home with good friends. Daily specials and soups are awesome.

data.title: Great Breakfast!
data.text: Janie's is a wonderful cafe in downtown Longmont. I have been having breakfasts here for 12 - 13 years.

data.title: Great but disappointing
data.text: One bad thing is they're only open in the morning, even though they are a cute little cafe. Another bad thing is the staff tend to stand around and watch you eat. Another bad thing is I ordered a steak and they served me a white slab of meat that was white on the inside and it tasted like pork. They said it was beef but it tasted and looked like a pork chop, I didn't complain though. This cafe seems to always be filled with elderly folks, not a bad thing at all! Pretty busy place though, which is disappointing after finding parking a mile away and walking. No parking isn't good as the cafe is right on main. The food does taste really good and the staff is friendly. Nice place, you've gotta try it!

data.title: Good home cooking, Southern style.
data.text: Good food, good service, big portions -- all with a touch of Southern hospitality and flavors. The corn bread pieces are huge. The fish and chips with hush puppies is fantastic. Also love the chicken fried chicken. And I can't forget their wonderful french toast with their own topping. Come hungry, go away happy.

data.title: Great little breakfast Cafe
data.text: Stopped in for a quick breakfast and was not disappointed. Great service and a good and fast breakfast. Had the biscuits and gray with a perfectly cooked over medium egg. Clean fast and efficient. What more could you ask for?

data.title: Typical breakfast joint - good basic food
data.text: Have had breakfast here several times.  Janie's is your basic cafe offering traditional breakfasts.  Food has always been good, and servers have always been pleasant & friendly.

data.title: Garrison Keillor Would Love This Cafe!
data.text:
I’m not kidding!  This humble looking restaurant is a positive jewel!  We always look for independent restaurants, and found this one in the ancient business district of Longmont.  It’s right out of the fifties, or older.  And management is on top of everything.  

A waffle is one of the most difficult items to cook properly.  As a light eater, I was delighted to find they serve a half-waffle.  I never saw that before!  It was flavorful, toasty on top, and served with warm syrup in a spotless pitcher.  

The staff is sincerely friendly, no pretense, they like people.  And the popularity of the cafe proved that the locals like Janie’s.  Highly recommended.  $

data.title: Best breakfast oround!
data.text: Love this place, very few left like Janie's anymore. Great food, price, employees and service. Thank you!

data.title: Family friendly, awesome service
data.text: Best breakfast in town, hands down. Waitstaff is friendly and fast. Food is filling, delicious, and reasonable. I recommend the chipotle sized breakfast burrito (the green chili is awesome). Also the vegetable beef soup is the best I've tasted.

data.title: An excellent value
data.text: Nothing fancy at Janie's. Just good food, excellent service, and an outstanding value. Your coffee cup will always be full. I like the omelettes. And if you're gluten-free, the GF is provided with no up charge. That's rare!
